statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: AMERICA EAST CONF TR AT BOSTON MA

article.headline: Hartford 49, Stony Brook 47
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Bo Taylor hit a turnaround 12-foot jumper from the baseline as time expired and Hartford held Stony Brook without a field goal for the final 16:40 Friday night, rallying for a 49-47 victory over the Seawolves in the first-round of the America East Conference tournament. The win advances the eighth-seeded Hawks (13-17) to Saturday's quarterfinal matchup with top-seeded Vermont. Hartford, which trailed by 20 in the first half and by 19 with 15:10 left, was down 44-27 with 12:38 remaining when it went on a 22-3 run the rest of the way. Taylor, named to the All-America East first team earlier in the day, ended what had been a bad night personally with his second field goal in eight tries. The winning basket was set up after Mitchell Beauford stepped out of bounds for Stony Brook's 17th turnover. Taylor finished with six points and a team-high 10 rebounds. Hartford's Joe Zeglinski, who made the league's All-Rookie team, led all scorers with 23 points and also had seven rebounds and three steals as the Hawks beat ninth-seeded Stony Brook (9-20) for the third time this year. Mike Popoko led Stony Brook, which was 3-for-19 from the field in the second half, with 11 points and 11 rebounds. The Vermont-Hartford game kicks off Saturday's four-game tournament schedule. The first round and quarter- and semifinals are being played here with the final game scheduled for March 10 at the site of the higher surviving seed.
